intro: Tetraglochidium hirtisepalum, commonly known as the hairy-sepal tetraglochidium, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Its hairy sepals are a distinguishing feature, contributing to its common name. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
